similar: It's a mix of happy and sad.
I have conflicting feelings about this.
Glad it's over, but sad to see it end.
expression_580.example:
A: Today is my last day at the firm after ten years.
B: How are you feeling? It must be a big change.
A: Honestly? It's kind of bittersweet. I'm excited for the new gig, but I'll miss everyone here.
B: I bet. You've made some great friends over the years.
A: Facts. We've been through a lot together.
B: Well, at least we're throwing you a dope goodbye party tonight.

expression_581.primary: I'm at a loss for words.
similar: I don't know what to say.
expression_581.example:
A: Surprise! We all pitched in to get you that guitar you've been eyeing!
B: Oh my god... I'm at a loss for words right now. You guys are the best.
A: We know how much you've been wanting to start playing again.
B: This is incredible. I'm literally shaking.
A: Just start practicing! We expect a concert by next month.
B: Facts. I'm gonna get on that right away. Thank you so much!

similar: We did more than what was required.
expression_582.example:
A: The client was absolutely blown away by the final presentation.
B: That's great! We really went the extra mile with those custom animations.
A: For real. It took us all weekend, but it was totally worth it.
B: Facts. Now we're definitely gonna get that contract extension.
A: I'm just glad everyone's hard work paid off.
B: Let's celebrate with a team dinner tonight.

similar: I cut them out of my life.
They are no longer in my circle.
expression_583.example:
A: Haven't seen you hanging out with that group lately. What happened?
B: Honestly? I canceled them after that drama last weekend. I don't need that energy.
A: Wow, that's a bold move. They were your main friends for a while.
B: I know, but life is too short for toxic people. No cap.
A: I feel you. Sometimes you just gotta protect your peace.
B: Facts. I'm much happier already.

similar: I had so much to do.
expression_584.example:
A: Sorry I didn't get back to your text yesterday.
B: No worries! I figured you were swamped with work for the big launch.
A: For real. I didn't even have time to eat lunch until 4 PM.
B: That sounds intense. Hope things are calming down today.
A: A little bit, but I still have a mountain of emails to get through.
B: Facts. The grind never stops, huh?

similar: You're getting it for next to nothing.
expression_585.example:
A: I found this high-end blender at a garage sale for five dollars!
B: No way! That's as cheap as chips. Those usually go for over a hundred.
A: I know! I checked the price online as soon as I got home.
B: You really scored big time today. Does it even work?
A: Perfectly. I already made a smoothie this morning.
B: Facts. What a lucky find!

similar: Treat this place like your own.
expression_586.example:
A: Thanks for letting me stay here while I look for an apartment.
B: Of course! Make yourself at home. There's plenty of space in the fridge.
A: You're a lifesaver. I'll try not to get in the way too much.
B: Chill. We've been friends for years. Just do your thing.
A: I really appreciate it, for real.
B: Say less. Let's grab some takeout tonight.

similar: Take the deal as it is.
That's it, take it or walk away.
expression_587.example:
A: I'll give you fifty bucks for that vintage jacket.
B: No way, it's worth at least eighty. Sixty-five, take it or leave it.
A: Sixty is the most I can do right now, honestly.
B: Alright, fine. Take it or leave it, sixty is the final price.
A: Okay, deal. I've been looking for this specific style for weeks.
B: Facts. It's a classic piece.

expression_588.primary: I don't want to have egg on my face.
similar: I don't want to look foolish.
I don't want to be humiliated.
I'm trying to avoid a public fail.
expression_588.example:
A: Are you sure about these statistics for the meeting?
B: Definitely. I don't want to have egg on my face in front of the board.
A: Good thinking. They can be pretty brutal with their questions.
B: For real. I've double-checked everything three times already.
A: Better safe than sorry when it comes to the executives.
B: Facts. I'm ready for whatever they throw at me.

similar: I have a big decision to make.
I'm faced with a difficult choice.
My life is about to change direction.
I'm uncertain about which path to take.
expression_589.example:
A: I'm not sure if I should stay at this job or go back to grad school.
B: It sounds like you're at a crossroads. What does your gut tell you?
A: Honestly, it change every day. One minute I'm ready to quit, the next I'm fine.
B: Maybe take a week off and clear your head?
A: That's a good idea. I need to figure out what I really want long-term.
B: Facts. Don't rush into anything you'll regret later.

expression_590.example:
A: You always seem so honest about everything in your life.
B: Yeah, I'm an open book. I don't see the point in hiding things.
A: I wish I could be more like that. I'm always worried about what people think.
B: Life is much easier when you're just yourself. No cap.
A: I guess it takes a lot of confidence to be that vulnerable.
B: Facts. But it's totally worth it for the real connections you make.

expression_591.primary: There was a little bit of a kerfuffle.
similar: There was a bit of a fuss.
Things got a little messy for a second.
expression_591.example:
A: What was all that noise in the lobby earlier?
B: Oh, there was a little bit of a kerfuffle over a missing delivery.
A: Did they figure it out? Everyone sounded pretty heated.
B: Yeah, turns out it was just at the wrong door. All good now.
A: People really lose their cool over the smallest things sometimes.
B: Facts. Delivery day brings out the crazy in everyone.

expression_592.primary: The boys didn't cut the mustard.
similar: They failed to meet the standard.
They were inadequate for the task.
They fell short of the goal.
expression_592.example:
A: How did the new interns do on their first assignment?
B: Honestly? The boys didn't cut the mustard. I've had to redo most of it.
A: That's disappointing. I thought they were supposed to be top-tier.
B: They have the degrees, but no real-world experience. It shows.
A: Maybe they just need a bit more time to adjust?
B: Possibly, but right now, it's more work for me. Facts.

expression_593.primary: How thoughtful of you to say that.
similar: Thank you for being so kind.
That's very nice of you to mention.
That means a lot coming from you.
expression_593.example:
A: I really think your new project is going to change the industry.
B: Wow, how thoughtful of you to say that. I've been working so hard on it.
A: It really shows. Your dedication is inspiring, for real.
B: I appreciate the support. It's been a long journey.
A: You deserve all the success that's coming your way.
B: Facts. Thank you so much for the encouragement.

expression_594.primary: There is a fat chance of you winning.
similar: You have very little chance of winning.
Zero chance of you taking the W.
expression_594.example:
A: I'm thinking about entering the city marathon next month.
B: Honestly? There is a fat chance of you winning against those pros.
A: Hey! I've been training for three months already!
B: I know, but these guys train for years. Just being realistic.
A: I'm still gonna do it for the experience though.
B: Facts. That's a better mindset anyway. Just finish the race!

similar: He got the hint at last.
He's finally on the same page.
He finally realized what was going on.
expression_595.example:
A: After three warnings, he finally stopped showing up late.
B: Good. It took him long enough, but he finally got the message.
A: I was about to let him go, honestly.
B: I think the threat of losing the job really motivated him.
A: Facts. Some people just need a wake-up call to change.
B: Glad things are finally running smoothly in the office.

expression_596.example:
A: He told the boss he finished the entire report over the weekend.
B: No way! I saw him at the beach on Saturday. He's lying through his teeth.
A: I knew it! His version of the story didn't make any sense.
B: For real. He thinks he can just fake his way through everything.
A: I should probably mention what I saw to the manager then.
B: Facts. Don't let him get away with that. It's not fair to the team.

similar: This is the first I'm hearing of it.
That's a new one for me.
expression_597.example:
A: Did you hear that the office is moving to Brooklyn next month?
B: Wait, really? This is news to me! No one mentioned it to my team.
A: They just announced it in the company newsletter this morning.
B: I must have missed that email. That's a huge change for my commute.
A: For real. You might want to check for more details ASAP.
B: Facts. I'm going to talk to HR right now.

expression_598.example:
A: We've been sitting here for two hours talking about the plan.
B: You're right. It's time to get moving and actually execute.
A: Ready when you are. Let's head to the site.
B: Grab your gear and let's go. We have a lot of work ahead.
A: No more talking, just doing from now on.
B: Facts. Let's show them what we're capable of.

similar: Exactly, that's what I want to hear!
expression_599.example:
A: I'm not gonna let that setback stop me. I'm gonna try again tomorrow!
B: That's the spirit! I knew you wouldn't give up that easily.
A: For real. One failure doesn't define the whole project.
B: Facts. Consistency is the key to winning anyway.
A: I'm feeling more motivated than ever now.
B: Let's get it! I'm right behind you.

similar: I'm on the road to recovery.
expression_600.example:
A: How are you feeling after that flu you had last week?
B: Much better, thanks. I'm on the mend and should be back in the office by Monday.
A: That's great news! We've really missed having you around.
B: I missed being there too. Staying in bed all day is so boring.
A: Rest up for a few more days just to be safe though.
B: Facts. I don't want to overdo it and get sick again.

similar: I'm on board with your idea.
expression_601.example:
A: Think about it: we'd have a pool, a private chef, and zero noise.
B: Honestly? You sold me with the 'private chef' part. Let's book the villa.
A: I knew that would be the game changer for you!
B: For real. I'm tired of cooking every single day while on vacation.
A: It's gonna be the most relaxing trip ever, I promise.
B: Facts. I'm already counting down the days.

expression_602.primary: I can't wrap my head around that.
similar: I don't understand it at all.
I'm struggling to grasp the concept.
It makes no sense to me.
expression_602.example:
A: They're saying the universe is constantly expanding into... what, exactly?
B: Honestly, I can't wrap my head around that either. It's too abstract.
A: My brain literally starts hurting when I think about it for too long.
B: Same. Physics is just on a whole different level, no cap.
A: Maybe we should just stick to talking about movies instead.
B: Facts. That's much easier for my human brain to handle.

similar: That's lovely of you to do.
expression_603.example:
A: I brought you some homemade soup since I heard you were feeling under the weather.
B: Aw, that's so sweet of you! I really needed this right now.
A: It's my grandma's recipe, so it's guaranteed to make you feel better.
B: You're a lifesaver, for real. I'm gonna eat it right away.
A: Let me know if you need anything else from the store later.
B: Facts. You're the best friend a person could ask for.

similar: Leave it to me, I'll solve it.
expression_604.example:
A: We lost the keys to the storage unit and we need that gear by tomorrow morning!
B: Chill. I'll figure it out. I think I know where they might be hidden.
A: I've looked everywhere! I'm starting to panic, honestly.
B: Just take a deep breath. I've got this under control.
A: I hope so. We really can't afford any more delays.
B: Facts. I'll hit you up as soon as I find them.

expression_605.primary: Mobile technology is taking center stage.
similar: Everything is revolving around smartphones now.
Mobile technology is the main focus.
expression_605.example:
A: Why are we prioritizing the mobile app over the web version this year?
B: Look at the data. Mobile technology is taking center stage for our users.
A: True, over eighty percent of our traffic comes from phones now.
B: Exactly. We need to go where our audience is already spending their time.
A: It's a big shift, but it definitely makes sense for the brand.
B: Facts. It's all about staying relevant in this market.

expression_606.primary: He will lay bare the ugly truth.
similar: He will reveal the harsh reality.
He's going to tell the unfiltered truth.
expression_606.example:
A: I heard the CEO is giving a state-of-the-company speech tomorrow.
B: Yeah, and everyone's nervous because he said he will lay bare the ugly truth about our finances.
A: No more corporate fluff then? That's actually kind of refreshing.
B: In a way, yeah, but it might mean some serious layoffs are coming.
A: That's the scary part. We've known things were bad for a while though.
B: Facts. It's better to know the truth than to live in denial.

expression_607.primary: I will leave no stone unturned.
similar: I'll be thorough in my search.
I won't stop until I find it.
I'm going to look into every detail.
expression_607.example:
A: We still haven't found the source of the leak in the database.
B: Don't worry. I will leave no stone unturned until we identify the problem.
A: We've checked the logs, the server, everything... it's like a ghost.
B: I'm going to do a deep dive into the actual code structure tonight.
A: I appreciate the dedication. This is a critical issue for us.
B: Facts. I won't sleep until this is resolved.

similar: I'm going to hit the gym.
Heading to the fitness center now.
expression_608.example:
A: Hey, you wanna grab some pizza after work?
B: I wish! But I'm off to the gym. I've been slacking lately.
A: Respect. I should probably go too, but I'm just too lazy today.
B: Come with me! You'll feel so much better after a good session.
A: Maybe tomorrow. For now, it's just me and my sofa.
B: Facts. Enjoy your rest then, I'll see you later!

expression_609.example:
A: Why are you being so quiet today? Is everything okay?
B: Look, here's the thing: I'm just really stressed about this move next week.
A: Oh! I thought I did something to annoy you!
B: No, not at all. It's just a lot to handle all by myself.
A: I'm so sorry! I should have realized you needed some help.
B: Facts. If you have any free time this weekend, let me know.

expression_610.primary: The day can't come soon enough.
similar: I'm so looking forward to it.
I can't wait for that day.
I wish it were that day already.
expression_610.example:
A: Only three more days until we leave for Europe!
B: For real. The day can't come soon enough. I'm so ready to disconnect.
A: Have you finished all your packing yet?
B: Almost. I just need to grab a few travel-size toiletries today.
A: I'm so jealous! Take lots of pictures for me.
B: Facts. I'll be posting them all over my feed, don't worry.

similar: He has a lot of power.
He's a big deal in the industry.
People listen to what he says.
expression_611.example:
A: How did he manage to get a meeting with the investors so quickly?
B: Honestly? He has serious clout in the tech world. One phone call and he's in.
A: I wish I had that kind of influence. It would make things so much easier.
B: It takes years to build that kind of reputation, for real.
A: Facts. I guess I'll just have to keep grinding until I get there.
B: That's the only way to do it. Keep pushing.

similar: He went missing without a trace.
expression_612.example:
A: Where did that guy go who was talking to us earlier?
B: Man, I have no idea. He literally vanished into thin air as soon as I turned my back.
A: That's so creepy! He didn't even say goodbye or anything.
B: For real. It's like he just phased out of reality. This place is weird.
A: Maybe he was just an NPC in our simulation?
B: Facts. Let's get out of here before something else happens.

similar: I'm still waiting for an answer on the original point.
expression_613.example:
A: So, about the money you owe me from last month...
B: Oh! Did you see that the new season of that show just dropped?
A: Yo, don't change the subject. We were talking about the fifty bucks.
B: Alright, alright. I'll Venmo you right now, chill out.
A: Thank you. I've been asking you for weeks, man.
B: Facts. My bad. It slipped my mind, I promise.

expression_614.primary: I'm a glass half full person.
similar: I try to look on the bright side.
I focus on the good things.
expression_614.example:
A: Everything is going wrong today! This project is a absolute disaster.
B: Look, I'm a glass half full person. At least we found the problem early.
A: How can you be so positive right now? We're literally three days behind schedule!
B: Panicking won't help. Let's just focus on what we can fix today.
A: I guess you're right. Your attitude is actually kind of helpful, for real.
B: Facts. Let's just take it one step at a time and we'll get through it.

similar: Money isn't easy to come by.
You have to work hard for your cash.
We need to be careful with our spending.
Wealth doesn't just appear out of nowhere.
expression_615.example:
A: Can I get those new three-hundred-dollar sneakers for my birthday?
B: Listen, money doesn't grow on trees. You need to show me you're taking your chores seriously first.
A: But all my friends already have them! I feel so left out.
B: I understand, but that doesn't mean we can just blow our budget on shoes.
A: Fine, I'll start helping out around the house more then.
B: Facts. Show me some effort and we'll talk about it next month.

expression_616.primary: Let's get into the swing of things.
similar: Let's get accustomed to the routine.
Time to get into the flow of work.
Let's familiarize ourselves with the situation.
Time to start working at our usual pace.
expression_616.example:
A: It's my first day back after a two-week vacation and my brain is totally fried.
B: No worries. Let's just get into the swing of things slowly. No stress.
A: I have three hundred unread emails! Where do I even start?
B: Just pick one, handle it, and move to the next. You'll be back in the flow in no time.
A: I hope so. I feel like I've forgotten how to do my basic job tasks.
B: Facts. It happens to the best of us after a long break.

similar: I'm in the process of doing it.
I haven't forgotten, I'm making progress.
expression_617.example:
A: Have you finished the design for the new landing page yet?
B: I'm working on it right now. It should be ready by the end of the day.
A: Awesome. The client is really eager to see the initial concepts.
B: For real. I'm just trying to make sure the color palette is perfect.
A: Take your time, then. Quality over speed every single time.
B: Facts. I'll send you a preview link in a couple of hours.

similar: She told us something that blew our minds.
She gave us a huge surprise.
expression_618.example:
A: Did you hear about Sarah at the meeting earlier?
B: Yeah! She dropped a bombshell that she's moving to Japan next month!
A: No way! I had no idea she was even thinking about leaving the country.
B: For real. Everyone was just sitting there in total shock. It was wild.
A: I wonder what prompted such a big change so suddenly?
B: Facts. I'm definitely going to reach out and ask her about it tonight.

similar: I was in a difficult dilemma.
I was faced with two equally tough choices.
I didn't know which way to turn.
I was stuck in a complex situation.
I was in a real pickle.
expression_619.example:
A: Why did you take so long to decide between the two job offers?
B: Honestly? I was in a real quandary. Both had amazing benefits and great teams.
A: That's a good problem to have, but I bet it was still stressful.
B: 100%. I literally made a pro and con list that was three pages long.
A: So what finally made you choose the startup over the big bank?
B: Facts. The potential for growth and the creative freedom just felt more 'me'.

expression_620.example:
A: I'm planning a surprise party for Mike's thirtieth birthday next week.
B: No way! He's gonna be so shocked. I won't say a word.
A: Perfect. Keep a lid on it because he's really good at guessing surprises.
B: Trust me, my lips are sealed. I won't even mention the date to anyone.
A: Thanks. I want this to be the best party he's ever had.
B: Facts. He's a great guy, he definitely deserves it.

similar: I stayed up all night to work.
I didn't sleep at all last night.
I was awake through the entire night.
I worked until the sun came up.
I had zero sleep because of this project.
expression_621.example:
A: You look absolutely exhausted today. What happened?
B: Ugh, I pulled an all-nighter trying to finish that final report before the deadline.
A: Wow! You really should have started on it earlier, man.
B: I know, I know. I'm a terrible procrastinator. It finally caught up with me.
A: Well, at least it's done now. Go home and crash for twelve hours.
B: Facts. I'm gonna fall asleep as soon as my head hits the pillow.

expression_622.primary: He has a heart of gold.
similar: He would do anything for anyone.
He's the sweetest person I know.
expression_622.example:
A: I heard Jim spent his entire Saturday helping that new family move in.
B: That doesn't surprise me. He really has a heart of gold.
A: For real. He never asks for anything in return either. He's just naturally helpful.
B: Exactly. We need more people like him in this world, honestly.
A: Facts. He's a real gem of a human being.
B: I'm glad he's part of our team, for sure.

expression_623.primary: Everything is up in the air.
similar: We're still waiting for a final decision.
expression_623.example:
A: Are we still going to the conference in Vegas next month?
B: Honestly? Everything is up in the air right now because of the budget cuts.
A: Oh no! I was really looking forward to that trip.
B: Same here, but we're just waiting for the final word from the management.
A: I hope they don't cancel it at the last minute.
B: Facts. It's frustrating not knowing what's going to happen.

similar: I haven't made up my mind yet.
I'm not sure which way to go.
expression_624.example:
A: Do you want to join the company softball team this season?
B: Honestly? I'm on the fence. I'm worried about the time commitment.
A: It's only once a week! It's a great way to meet people from other departments.
B: I know, but I also have that evening class on Thursdays...
A: Just come to the first practice and see if you like the vibe.
B: Facts. I'll think about it and let you know by tomorrow morning.

similar: I felt a shock of fear/excitement.
My breath hitched for a second.
I had a momentary heart attack from shock.
expression_625.example:
A: Did you see that guy almost get hit by that taxi earlier?
B: Oh man, my heart skipped a beat just watching it! That was so close.
A: For real. He wasn't even looking at the road, just staring at his phone.
B: People really need to be more careful in this city. It's dangerous out here.
A: Facts. I'm still feeling a little shaky from seeing it, honestly.
B: Glad he's okay though. That was almost a disaster.

expression_626.primary: This is a walk in the park.
similar: I can do this with my eyes closed.
expression_626.example:
A: Wow, that coding challenge looks really intense. Are you gonna be okay?
B: Honestly? This is a walk in the park for me. I've done way harder stuff than this.
A: Respect. I would have no idea where to even start with that logic.
B: Once you learn the fundamentals, it's just like solving a puzzle.
A: I'll have to take your word for it. Good luck anyway!
B: Facts. I'll have this finished in ten minutes, just watch.

similar: I don't necessarily agree with that.
Don't include me in your statement.
expression_627.example:
A: Everyone is so bored during these weekly meetings, right?
B: Hey! Speak for yourself. I actually find the updates quite helpful.
A: Seriously? It's just two hours of people talking about things that don't matter.
B: Well, some of us actually like knowing what's going on in the rest of the firm.
A: I guess I'm just more task-oriented than you are then.
B: Facts. Different strokes for different folks, I guess.

similar: Focus and do a better job.
expression_628.example:
A: I forgot my laptop at home again and I have a presentation in ten minutes!
B: Seriously? You really need to get your act together. This is the third time this month.
A: I know, I know. My morning routine is just so chaotic lately.
B: Maybe try setting a checklist by the door or something. You're gonna get fired.
A: You're right. I'm gonna make some serious changes starting tonight.
B: Facts. Consistency and reliability are everything in this industry.

expression_629.example:
A: Aren't you worried about the major changes they announced for next year?
B: Honestly? I'm not phased. I've been through plenty of corporate restructures before.
A: I wish I had your confidence. I'm already looking for other job opportunities.
B: Chill out. Change is part of life. Just adapt and keep moving forward.
A: I guess you're right. Experience really does make a difference, huh?
B: Facts. Once you've seen it all, nothing really surprises you anymore.
